history.proof: intros H. inversion H. subst. split. - reflexivity. - apply lb_mask_inv_nil. auto.

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
x: bool
l: lb

Goal:
x :: l ⪯ nil -> x = ⟘ /\ l ⪯ nil

Premises:
Inductive list (A : Type) : Type := nil : list A | cons : A -> list A -> list A Arguments list _%type_scope Arguments nil {A}%type_scope Arguments cons {A}%type_scope a l%list_scope : rename
Inductive lb_mask : lb -> lb -> Prop := in_lb_mask_0 : forall l : lb, nil ⪯ l | in_lb_mask_1 : forall l : lb, l ⪯ nil -> ⟘ :: l ⪯ nil | in_lb_mask_2 : forall (x y : bool) (l m : lb), x ⪦ y -> l ⪯ m -> x :: l ⪯ y :: m Arguments lb_mask (_ _)%list_scope Arguments in_lb_mask_0 _%list_scope Arguments in_lb_mask_1 [l]%list_scope Arguments in_lb_mask_2 (_ _)%bool_scope [l m]%list_scope
in_lb_mask_1 : forall l : lb, l ⪯ nil -> ⟘ :: l ⪯ nil
lb_mask_inv_nil : forall l : lb, ⟘ :: l ⪯ nil -> l ⪯ nil
lb_mask_sind : forall P : lb -> lb -> SProp, (forall l : lb, P nil l) -> (forall l : lb, l ⪯ nil -> P l nil -> P (⟘ :: l) nil) -> (forall (x y : bool) (l m : lb), x ⪦ y -> l ⪯ m -> P l m -> P (x :: l) (y :: m)) -> forall l l0 : lb, l ⪯ l0 -> P l l0
lb_mask_ind : forall P : lb -> lb -> Prop, (forall l : lb, P nil l) -> (forall l : lb, l ⪯ nil -> P l nil -> P (⟘ :: l) nil) -> (forall (x y : bool) (l m : lb), x ⪦ y -> l ⪯ m -> P l m -> P (x :: l) (y :: m)) -> forall l l0 : lb, l ⪯ l0 -> P l l0
in_lb_mask_2 : forall (x y : bool) (l m : lb), x ⪦ y -> l ⪯ m -> x :: l ⪯ y :: m
in_lb_mask_0 : forall l : lb, nil ⪯ l
app_eq_unit : forall (A : Type) (x y : list A) (a : A), x ++ y = a :: nil -> x = nil /\ y = a :: nil \/ x = a :: nil /\ y = nil
app_eq_nil : forall (A : Type) (l l' : list A), l ++ l' = nil -> l = nil /\ l' = nil
app_inj_tail : forall (A : Type) (x y : list A) (a b : A), x ++ a :: nil = y ++ b :: nil -> x = y /\ a = b
Ascii.N_of_digits = fix N_of_digits (l : lb) : BinNums.N := match l with | nil => BinNums.N0 | b :: l' => BinNat.N.add (if b then BinNums.Npos BinNums.xH else BinNums.N0) (BinNat.N.mul (BinNums.Npos (BinNums.xO BinNums.xH)) (N_of_digits l')) end : lb -> BinNums.N Arguments Ascii.N_of_digits _%list_scope
elt_eq_unit : forall (A : Type) (l1 l2 : list A) (a b : A), l1 ++ a :: l2 = b :: nil -> a = b /\ l1 = nil /\ l2 = nil
filter_In : forall (A : Type) (f : A -> bool) (x : A) (l : list A), In x (filter f l) < -> In x l /\ f x = ⟙
Ring.bool_ring_ring_lemma2 : forall (n : nat) (lH : list (Ring_polynom.PExpr bool * Ring_polynom.PExpr bool)) (l : lb), Ring_polynom.interp_PElist ⟘ ⟙ xorb andb xorb (fun b : bool => b) eq (Ring_theory.IDphi (R:=bool)) Ring_theory.id_phi_N (Ring_theory.pow_N ⟙ andb) l lH ->...-> Ring_polynom.PEeval ⟘ ⟙ xorb andb xorb (fun b : bool => b) (Ring_theory.IDphi (R:=bool)) Ring_theory.id_phi_N (Ring_theory.pow_N ⟙ andb) l pe = Ring_polynom.Pphi_dev ⟘ ⟙ xorb andb xorb (fun b : bool => b) ⟘ ⟙ Ring.bool_eq (Ring_theory.IDphi (R:=bool)) (Ring_theory.get_sign_None (C:=bool)) l npe
map_eq_cons : forall (A B : Type) (f : A -> B) (l : list A) (l' : list B) (b : B), map f l = b :: l' -> exists (a : A) (tl : list A), l = a :: tl /\ f a = b /\ map f tl = l'
Ring.bool_ring_ring_lemma1 : forall (n : nat) (l : lb) (lpe : list (Ring_polynom.PExpr bool * Ring_polynom.PExpr bool)) (pe1 pe2 : Ring_polynom.PExpr bool), Ring_polynom.interp_PElist ⟘ ⟙ xorb andb xorb (fun b : bool => b) eq (Ring_theory.IDphi (R:=bool)) Ring_theory.id_phi_N (Ring_theory.pow_N ⟙ andb) l lpe ->...-> Ring_polynom.PEeval ⟘ ⟙ xorb andb xorb (fun b : bool => b) (Ring_theory.IDphi (R:=bool)) Ring_theory.id_phi_N (Ring_theory.pow_N ⟙ andb) l pe1 = Ring_polynom.PEeval ⟘ ⟙ xorb andb xorb (fun b : bool => b) (Ring_theory.IDphi (R:=bool)) Ring_theory.id_phi_N (Ring_theory.pow_N ⟙ andb) l pe2
NoDup_ind : forall (A : Type) (P : list A -> Prop), P nil -> (forall (x : A) (l : list A), ~ In x l -> NoDup l -> P l -> P (x :: l)) -> forall l : list A, NoDup l -> P l
NoDup_sind : forall (A : Type) (P : list A -> SProp), P nil -> (forall (x : A) (l : list A), ~ In x l -> NoDup l -> P l -> P (x :: l)) -> forall l : list A, NoDup l -> P l
Relation_Operators.Desc_sind : forall (A : Set) (leA : A -> A -> Prop) (P : list A -> SProp), P nil -> (forall x : A, P (x :: nil)) -> (forall (x y : A) (l : list A), Relation_Operators.clos_refl A leA x y -> Relation_Operators.Desc A leA (l ++ y :: nil) -> P (l ++ y :: nil) -> P ((l ++ y :: nil) ++ x :: nil)) -> forall l : list A, Relation_Operators.Desc A leA l -> P l
Relation_Operators.Desc_ind : forall (A : Set) (leA : A -> A -> Prop) (P : list A -> Prop), P nil -> (forall x : A, P (x :: nil)) -> (forall (x y : A) (l : list A), Relation_Operators.clos_refl A leA x y -> Relation_Operators.Desc A leA (l ++ y :: nil) -> P (l ++ y :: nil) -> P ((l ++ y :: nil) ++ x :: nil)) -> forall l : list A, Relation_Operators.Desc A leA l -> P l
rev_ind : forall (A : Type) (P : list A -> Prop), P nil -> (forall (x : A) (l : list A), P l -> P (l ++ x :: nil)) -> forall l : list A, P l
Forall_ind : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) (P0 : list A -> Prop), P0 nil -> (forall (x : A) (l : list A), P x -> Forall P l -> P0 l -> P0 (x :: l)) -> forall l : list A, Forall P l -> P0 l
Forall_sind : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) (P0 : list A -> SProp), P0 nil -> (forall (x : A) (l : list A), P x -> Forall P l -> P0 l -> P0 (x :: l)) -> forall l : list A, Forall P l -> P0 l
Relation_Operators.Ltl_ind : forall (A : Set) (leA : A -> A -> Prop) (P : list A -> list A -> Prop), (forall (a : A) (x : list A), P nil (a :: x)) -> (forall a b : A, leA a b -> forall x y : list A, P (a :: x) (b :: y)) -> (forall (a : A) (x y : list A), Relation_Operators.Ltl A leA x y -> P x y -> P (a :: x) (a :: y)) -> forall l l0 : list A, Relation_Operators.Ltl A leA l l0 -> P l l0
Relation_Operators.Ltl_sind : forall (A : Set) (leA : A -> A -> Prop) (P : list A -> list A -> SProp), (forall (a : A) (x : list A), P nil (a :: x)) -> (forall a b : A, leA a b -> forall x y : list A, P (a :: x) (b :: y)) -> (forall (a : A) (x y : list A), Relation_Operators.Ltl A leA x y -> P x y -> P (a :: x) (a :: y)) -> forall l l0 : list A, Relation_Operators.Ltl A leA l l0 -> P l l0

```coq
intros H.
inversion H.
subst.
split.
- reflexivity.
- apply lb_mask_inv_nil.
  assumption.
Qed.
